Case reference: 2014001521.CaseDesc: On November 3, 1972, a helicopter carrying a pilot and three passengers went missing in Lake Winnipeg. The helicopter left Thompson, Manitoba at 3:20 p.m. and was heading for Winnipeg after stopping at a number of communities. The helicopter landed at Warren's Landing at approximately 5:20 p.m., and left for Winnipeg. The pilot reported that the weather was poor and he estimated his arrival in Winnipeg at 8:00 p.m. At 5:50 p.m. there was radio contact with the pilot where he stated that he was over Poplar River. This was the last radio contact with this helicopter. The Canadian Air Search and Rescue, private aircraft and police aircraft searched until November 17, 1972 when the search was suspended until the spring of 1973. Nathan Kryger and Ian Fraser are presumed dead as a result of the helicopter crash. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2017040789.CaseDesc: In 2016, Samantha Fiddler left Canada to go to the state of Florida in the United States of America. Samantha was last known to be in the area of Bartow, Florida. Her family has not heard from her since November 2016.

Case reference: 2014005457.CaseDesc: On July 7, 2010, Roosdianajati and Didik Harijanto were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Roosdianajati and Didik were scheduled to work, but did not show up for their shifts.

Case reference: 2013000017.CaseDesc: In August 1983, Jannisina "Jan" Stonehouse left her home in Oakville and has not been seen since. She may have left home due to being pregnant.  Jannisina may have been in the company of Darlene Tucker who is also missing. Refer to case 1993001330

Teeth: Good, Four teeth treated (one tooth had partial nerve treatment), one tooth absent lower left jaw. Dental chart on file.

Case reference: 2018008230.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1993, Trevor Chase was seen for the last time by his relatives in Truro, Nova Scotia. Trevor’s family believed that he may have been residing in Vancouver, British Columbia, in 1994.

Case reference: 2006019699.CaseDesc:
Pierre Couture was last seen in Cowansville, Quebec. He may have been hiding from
authorities and has not been seen since that time.

Case reference: 2014003189.CaseDesc: On January 15, 1986, Michel Guertin was seen for the last time in Sorel-Tracy, Quebec. Michel has not been seen or not heard from him since.

Case reference: 2011762660.CaseDesc: Brittany Stalman was last seen on Crawford Drive, Delta, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014002008.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1999, Pierre Bédard was seen for the last time while he left his home in Levis, Quebec. Mr. Bédard’s vehicle was located at Anse Benson in the St- Romuald neighbourhood in Levis.

Case reference: 2014003132.CaseDesc: On December 29, 1978, Sharon Drover was seen for the last time. Ms. Drover left her boarding house located in downtown St. John's, Newfoundland and arrived for her evening shift at McDonald’s restaurant. She finished her shift after midnight.

Case reference: 2009247848.CaseDesc: Christopher and Alexander are missing from the York region but were located in Poland where they are residing with their non-custodial mother.

Case reference: 2014006135.CaseDesc: In December 2012, Victor Pedtchenko was last seen in the area of 55 Triller Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. Victor had not been seen for one month before being reported missing.

Case reference: 2005001599.CaseDesc: Shawn Jones and Leslie Jones were seen on October 24, 1993. The two boys were hitchhiking from Cape Croker to Wiarton. They were dropped off in downtown Wiarton. Between October 26-28, 1993 Leslie Jones was seen with another male fitting the description of Shawn Jones. They were seen together at the Tim Hortons coffee shop in Owen Sound, Ontario. Shawn Jones was last seen on Berford Street in front of Pacific Hotel. Leslie Jones was last seen in front of the Tim Horton's restaurant on 9th East Street.

Case reference: 2016068405.CaseDesc: On March 29, 1970, the remains of a male were found on the Lake Erie shore in Point Pelee National Park. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated that he had been in the water for approximately 1 week to 6 months prior to discovery.

Case reference: 2006004699.CaseDesc: On 13 July 1992, William Aman left the shore of Lake Ontario to go fishing.  His boat was later found with his ball cap 3.2 kilometers off of Pete's Point, Lake Ontario. Mr. Aman has not been located and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2021009119.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2021, Amber Ellis was reported missing by her mother. Amber communicated with her friends and family, including her two children, on a regular basis prior to her disappearance. During the time of her disappearance, Amber was leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Scar: Left Thigh, Scar from a stab wound

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Teeth: Visible Decay, Missing an upper front tooth on the left side prior to death. The upper front tooth on the right side was angled.
Deformity: Left Knee, Osgoode-Schlatter's disease - bony bump on shin below knee

Case reference: 2014003060.CaseDesc: Pierre Lagacé was last seen on January 5, 2003. At the time, he was living in the Ville Lemoyne sector of Longueuil, Québec. Mr. Lagacé was reported missing by a family member. At the time of his disappearance, he had little money and no car in his name.

Case reference: 2017045193.CaseDesc: On July 18, 2017, Walter Allan left his residence to attend a coin collecting conference in Montreal, Quebec.  Walter did not attend the conference and on July 21, 2017, was last seen on security footage near Iberville, Quebec. Walter's vehicle was later located on August 24, 2017, in a field near Saint-Barthelemy, Quebec.

Case reference: 2013000143.CaseDesc: On February 13, 2013, Delvin D'Arcy's wife contacted the Fraser Lake RCMP to report her husband as missing. She advised them that Delvin was staying in Fort Fraser while working in the area. Delvin had contacted her on a regular basis but she has not heard from him since Feb 13, 2013.  It is believed that Mr. D'Arcy may be traveling to Ontario but he has not been heard of or seen since.

Hair: Black, White, Short, Salt and pepper grey

Case reference: 2020010925.CaseDesc: On October 2, 1990, Mabel Wong was seen for the last time, at approximately 10:30pm, as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario. It is believed that Mabel left her home to go meet someone. Her vehicle was found approximately two kilometers from her home.

Shoes: Leather, Black, CASUAL, with metal tips

Case reference: 2020007348.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1971, Liliam Alvarado was seen for the last time as she left her hotel room in Toronto, Ontario. Liliam left the hotel without her belongings.

Case reference: 2013000051.CaseDesc: Darren Fortier was last seen hitchhiking in Port Hardy on the evening of December 30, 1998.  Mr. Fortier had been involved in a serious injury a few years earlier which had left him with a metal plate and pins in his leg and a brain injury.

Hat: Cotton, Blue, Maroon, Colorado Avalanche Baseball Cap
Foreign Object: Left Thigh, Surgical Implant, Plate and 5 screws
Scar: Chin, Distinct on the left side of chin
Cheek, Down the right side of the face
Nose, Across the bridge of the nose

Case reference: 2014001434.CaseDesc: Mario Hudon was last seen on May 16, 1983, when he left his parents' home in Lévis, Quebec, on the south shore of Quebec City. Mario left some of his personal belongings at the residence.

Case reference: 2014005156.CaseDesc: On October 15, 2002, Jeanne Ouellette was seen for the last time at a Starbucks coffeehouse in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020001488.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1988, Edward Parsons was seen for the last time as he was dragged from his apartment by a street gang in Toronto, Ontario. Edward was taken to a beach where he was violently assaulted, and buried in a shallow grave. The police were informed of this incident, and attended the grave. Upon their arrival, the alleged burial site was found empty.

Case reference: 2012020112.CaseDesc: On February 14 2007, Philippe Lajoie was seen for the last time in Saint-Didace in the Lanaudière region, Quebec. He left his parents’ home at approximately 6 p.m. to go to a pig farm located on Petite-Rivière Nord road, in Yamachiche in the Mauricie region of Quebec. His vehicle was found there the next day.

Case reference: 2006006699.CaseDesc: Eric Larsfolk and John McCormick were last seen playing at the McCormick farm in Caledon. They have not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003746.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1972, Mario Cardinal was reported missing by his family. At the time of his disappearance, he lived in Trois-Rivières, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005826.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2012, the Banff RCMP were contacted by a tour company to report that Duc Dao and his son, Nguyen Dao of Vietnam did not arrive to board their bus at the scheduled time.  The two men had been staying at the Banff International Hotel and there were no personal items left in their room. The two men were due to fly back to Vietnam two days later. However, they did not board their scheduled flight and it is unknown if they returned to Vietnam.

Case reference: 2014001410.CaseDesc: Emma Dixon was last seen on July 22, 1964 at her home on Union Bar Reserve, in Hope, British Columbia. Her husband said that she may have gone to Washington for work. Emma never told anyone she was leaving and did not take any personal belongings. She was reported missing on August 20, 1964.

Case reference: 2014032043.CaseDesc:
On May 22nd, 1970, Philomena Sisson, age 68, was reported missing by her son, Harry Jack.  She had gone missing a few days earlier from his house on Boys Rd. in Duncan, BC.  Mrs. Sisson was reported to be an alcoholic who occasionally went missing for several days at a time. She also suffered from dementia. 
 
Mrs. Sisson's last surviving son has since passed away.  There was never any indication of foul play in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2019024246.CaseDesc: On May 6, 2019, Daniel Richards was seen for the last time in the area of Niagara Falls, Ontario. Niagara Police responded to a report of a man that had jumped into the falls. The police were able to obtain a description and a photograph of the man who was identified as Daniel. His vehicle was located abandoned in the nearby area.

Case reference: 2022005006.CaseDesc: In February 2021, Deana Timms was last seen in London, Ontario. Deana’s family and friends have not heard from her since this time. It is out of character for her to not be in contact with her loved ones for such an extended time.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Visible missing lower teeth
Scar: Left Index Finger, On the ring finger

Case reference: 2017061069.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1976, John Winer was seen for the last time as he sat on a railing near the falls in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Some of John’s personal belongings were found near the railing.

Case reference: 2021015656.CaseDesc: On October 22, 2017, Ann Victor-Lazarus was seen for the last time as she left her home to go to church. Ann’s vehicle was found in a parking lot near the “Parking Authority Water Intakes” on the Niagara River Parkway in Niagara Falls, New York State. Her personal belongings, as well as a note, were found in her vehicle. Ann was captured on video surveillance near the railing of the waterway.

Case reference: 2013000144.CaseDesc: Robert Angelo Furgiuele from Sault Ste-Marie, Ontario was last seen in Squamish, British-Columbia in 1991. He was residing in Squamish with his girlfriend and his daughter. He was working in a grocery store at the time. He last spoke to his mother by telephone in 1991. He might have moved to Vancouver Island, British-Columbia in 1992.

Case reference: 2009002399.CaseDesc: On Friday, April 21, 1972, Francis Harris went to a medical appointment with her husband in Peterborough. On the way home to Apsley, they stopped in Lakefield and she may have gone to the post office and the bank. They arrived home around 11:00 a.m. and ate lunch. Her husband went to work from approximately 1:00 p.m. to 5:05 p.m.  When their son returned home from school at about 3:40 p.m., Mrs. Harris was not home.  She has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Wavy, may have been dyed black
Ring: White gold engagement and wedding ring

Case reference: 2017068602.CaseDesc: On August 13, 2017, Martin Bertram McLearn was seen for the last time. He has moderate dementia and was reported missing from his home.

Boots: Rubber, Size 7; old, worn and cracked

Case reference: 2021059908.CaseDesc: On June 16, 2016, the partial remains of an unidentified man were recovered in Renews, Newfoundland. Between 2016 and 2018, additional remains belonging to this man were recovered.

Case reference: 2022049804.CaseDesc: On October 2, 2022, Christopher Crier was last seen at his residence on the Samson First Nation, Maskwacis, Alberta. Christopher broke up with his girlfriend and he may have been despondent when he left the residence.

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002751.CaseDesc: Rebecca Guno was last seen in June of 1983 by her common law husband. Miss Guno was taking a bus downtown with an unknown female friend, but did not arrive at her intended destination.

Case reference: 2018064370.CaseDesc: On November 8, 2018, at approximately 8:30 am, Artur Mis was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Artur did not show up for work on November 9 and 12th, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2005006599.CaseDesc:
On September 18, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was 163lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
Staining on his teeth suggest that he may have been a smoker. It is estimated that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Teeth: Stained, Overbite & several amalgam fillings. Several teeth lost/extracted during life; lower right lateral incisor being most obvious.

Case reference: 2014006175.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, at approximately 5:30 a.m., Jason Bathily and his twin sister, Clarene Bathily, were seen for the last time with their mother, Adelyne Mounga, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014028357.CaseDesc: On September 1, 2014, Meysam Mokri was seen for the last time leaving his family residence in Port Moody, British Columbia with a duffel bag containing some of his clothing. Meysam has not been seen or heard from since.

Shoes: Leather, White, Runners, Air Jordan brand, size 9

Case reference: 2014001313.CaseDesc: On August 26, 1976, at 11:00 pm, Frederick Seymour was seen for the last time as he stood outside of his residence in Ottawa, Ontario. Mr. Seymour had been seen by his neighbour.

Case reference: 2013000007.CaseDesc: Kimberly Ann McAndrew has been missing since August 12, 1989. At 4:20 p.m., she left the Canadian Tire where she was employed as a cashier. There were unconfirmed reports that Kimberly was last seen at the Gardenia Flower Shop in Penhorn Mall in Dartmouth. She was identified by an employee at the flower shop as having bought a balloon and a rose.

Shoes: Jade green, flat heeled slip on loafers

Case reference: 2014005970.CaseDesc: Gary Forster was last seen on January 13, 2013, in Lachute, Québec. His car was found in Montréal, Québec.

Case reference: 2009003699.CaseDesc: Michel Gagich, who typically goes by his middle name: Steve, was last seen by his father on Saturday, September 5, 2009 at his residence in Hamilton.  He left his residence on Sunday, September 6, 2009 in the morning, around 8:00 a.m. without speaking to his parents.  He left a note indicating that he was leaving for the weekend. Mr. Gagich's vehicle was located on Tuesday, September 8, 2009 at approximately 7:15 p.m. when a passing airplane observed a fire.  By the time the fire department arrived the vehicle was completely burned.  The vehicle was located in a remote area on Emmett Lake Road in St. Edmund's Township.  Mr. Gagich was last seen at the Tobermory Ferry Terminal on Wednesday, September 9, 2009 at 7 a.m.  It is not known if he purchased a ticket to board the ferry.  The MS Chi Cheemaun ferry provides transportation for vehicles and people from Tobermory to South Baymouth on Manitoulin Island.

Hair: Brown, Short, Dark, receding hair line; Moustache, Sideburns

Case reference: 2016030725.CaseDesc: Bryan Twan was reported missing in Quesnel, British Columbia, on June 7, 2016.  Bryan was last seen near Quesnel's West Park Mall and has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Denim, Light Blue, Yellow Drilling Rig Logo
Tattoo: Right Arm, BEV Heart and Unicorn

Case reference: 2020011797.CaseDesc: On June 21, 1986, John Edwards was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. John may have been despondent during the time of his disappearance.

Scar: Left Upper Arm, On left bicep

Case reference: 2016069642.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1995, the remains of a woman were discovered near Carbon, Alberta. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 10 and 15 years. The individual had dental restorations including stainless steel crowns.

Case reference: 2014002701.CaseDesc: On November 25, 1986, Carol Bigtobacco was reported missing to the RCMP. She was 8 years old when she was last seen 3 years earlier on March 19, 1983. It is believed she had wandered off from the family residence on Siksika Nation. She may have suffered from a disability.

Boots: One boot was found, unknown colour

Case reference: 2018054176.CaseDesc: On February 15, 1992, at approximately 10:00pm, Adu Frimpong was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020010478.CaseDesc: On January 30, 1970, at approximately 3:30pm, Lois Perret was last seen by her boyfriend at her place of work in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Lois had quit her job and moved out of her apartment. During the time of her disappearance, Lois was three months pregnant and drove a 1964 black Valiant convertible.

Case reference: 2014005913.CaseDesc: On October 27, 2012, Douglas Bender was seen for the last time in the North End area of Winnipeg, Manitoba. He is known to frequent the downtown area. It is uncharacteristic for him not to be in contact with his family. At the time of his disappearance, Douglas was despondent.

Jacket: Grey, Brown, Winter/parka with fur-trimmed hood

Case reference: 2014005355.CaseDesc: In November of 1990, Jose Valdez was last seen by a friend at his residence located in Edmonton, Alberta. Jose has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020645.CaseDesc: Peter Mckay was playing on the ice along the South Saskatchewan River in the Riversdale area of Saskatoon, SK in the late afternoon hours of December 31, 1986. Peter subsequently fell into an open portion of the river and was never found.

Jacket: Dark Blue, Orange, with a yellow stripe on the cuff

Case reference: 2014002126.CaseDesc: On March 18, 1997, Mark Bird was seen for the last time when he left his home in Welland, Ontario. His abandoned vehicle was later found in Niagara Falls. At the time of his disappearance, Mark was despondent and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Black, Hooded, San Francisco 49's football team

Case reference: 1996003690.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1994, Angela Arseneault was reported missing by her common law spouse. She was last seen on August 19, 1994, they and another male went shopping. Later that day, Angela left to catch a bus home alone. When her common law spouse returned home, the lights were on in the apartment, a window was left open and Angela’s purse was in the kitchen. Angela has not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Ankle, rose and stem (6 inches long)

Case reference: 2013000015.CaseDesc: On November 6, 1968, Robert Lessard went onto the Ottawa River in a boat, travelling to a hunting camp. He never arrived and the boat was located on the river.

Case reference: 2005001799.CaseDesc: On June 1, 1975, the body of an older adult female was located on the west bank of the Niagara River, in the town of Niagara-on-the-Lake. She is believed to be the same person who was witnessed jumping into the Horseshoe Falls on February 17, 1975. She is thought to be 40 plus years, short and heavy-set, with brown hair. She suffered from lung disease and had severe arthritis of her lumbar spine, which may have been painful. When witnessed going over the Falls, she was wearing a long overcoat, possibly grey, and carrying a green umbrella. There is no confirmation that the jumper and the deceased are the same person, however the general descriptions are in agreement. The condition of her remains suggest that she had been in the water for weeks to months.

Teeth: This female probably had a partial dental plate and still retained a gold crown on her right upper canine tooth.

Case reference: 2023018806.CaseDesc: Richard Duffy was last seen in December 1970 in the area of the Rio Grande River, New Mexico, United States. At the time of his disappearance, Richard was part of the US Marine Corps.

Case reference: 2014006231.CaseDesc: Luis Rodrigues was visiting Canada on a student visa. He was despondent over failing his classes and his visa being expired.

Case reference: 2018042433.CaseDesc: On July 28, 2018, Vesta Rosta was last seen leaving a Children Aid Society home in Brampton, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Vesta may be in the state of Maryland in the United States of America or in Romania with her parents, Pardelian Rosta and Bacrii Rostas.

Shirt: Black, Red, T-shirt, black with red writing

Case reference: 2015049499.CaseDesc: Loretta Garrett's husband and friends reported her missing on July 19, 1961. They were on a fishing trip near the mouth of the Moose Brook River in Northesk Parish, New Brunswick. The four of them shared a car and parked near the trailhead. The men hiked across a trail until they reached the water to fish. The women remained in the car. Shortly after, Loretta complained about the heat and bugs and started down the same trail as the men, but she was never seen again.

Case reference: 2014001425.CaseDesc: On August 3rd, 1986, RCMP received a report of a missing person. The manager of Sickle Lake Lodge called advising Mr. Hrynick went missing in the early morning hours. Mr. Hrynick was with friends during the evening before and into the early morning. According to them, Mr. Hrynick had been very quiet over the couple days leading up to his disappearance. The evening of his disappearance, Mr. Hrynick was described as intoxicated. At one point, witnesses observed him stumbling on his way out the door of the cabin. The other men went out to search for Mr. Hrynick about 15 minutes later. They could hear a boat but could not see Mr. Hrynick. The empty boat was located the following day. An extensive land and water search failed to locate Mr. Hrynick. There was no indication that Mr. Hrynick found his way to the shore and he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001664.CaseDesc: On September 12, 1982, Harold Larcher and his girlfriend set out in separate canoes with their supplies. Both canoes displayed their own leaks. After the river, they saw waves on the lake. The canoes began filling with water from these same waves.  Harold's girlfriends’ canoe sunk but she could see he was still in his canoe as she was struggling to right her own. She was unable to do so, but at one point was able to sit on top of it. Eventually she made her way to shore, however she did not see Harold again.  Numerous personal items belonging to Harold were recovered including his Passport and a life jacket that could have been his.  It is presumed Mr.Larcher drowned.

Case reference: 2014002159.CaseDesc: Jason Misurko was last known to be in Fort McMurray, Alberta on September 17, 1995. There have been no sightings or contact since then. His vehicle was later recovered in Enderby, B.C.

Case reference: 2006021399.CaseDesc: On June 28, 2000, Charles Siljander was last seen at the Marina Park in Thunder Bay, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance reports state that Charles appeared to be confused, forgetful, and that he had lost a significant amount of weight. On September 15, 2000, Charles’ abandoned vehicle, a grey 1981 Chevy pickup truck, was located on a logging road south of Thunder Bay, and near the Canadian and American border.

Case reference: 2016068711.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1969, an unidentified male was found 0.8 kilometres west of Sioux Lookout. His death appears to be self-inflicted

Case reference: 2014002535.CaseDesc: Ginette Landry was seen for the last time in Montreal on April 15, 1994. Ms. Landry would often travel for missions to help people in need.

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Teeth: Decayed teeth; gold inlay and prosthesis in his upper dentition; lower dentition had an amalgam filling
Shoes: Leather, Veritough, one left shoe; size 7
Scar: Right Upper Arm, circular puckered scar 1" in diameter on the anterior right underarm
Tattoo: Right Forearm, blue tattoo of a woman's face

Case reference: 2014001575.CaseDesc: On March 12, 1983, Samuel Amos Quatell was reported missing from the fishing vessel “ISE II”, near Steep Island, BC. Steep Island is located near Seymour Narrows; between Quadra Island and Campbell River, BC. Samuel was last seen near the rear of the vessel, by the ship’s crew.  An extensive search failed to locate Samuel. The tidal currents near the island are extremely strong and any person in the water could travel a great distance in a short period of time.

Amputation: Left Hand, Missing tip of ring finger

Case reference: 1996000260.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1995, Jay Boyle, Michael Cummings, Daniel Higgins, Jamie Lefebvre, Robert Rumbolt, and Chad Smith were seen for the last time walking towards the East Shore Marina in Pickering, Ontario. It is believed that the six young men boarded a boat that subsequently capsized.

Shoes: Red, Sneakers, Sneakers made of suede
Scar: Ears, Piercing scar on left ear

Hat: Black, Baseball hat-" Detroit Red Wings"

Shoes: Canvas, Black, White, Running shoes, brand "Adidas"

Case reference: 2014004925.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2007, Michael Bailey was last seen by the Thunder Bay Police on Bowlker Road in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Michael is known to travel on foot, and avoided being around people. During the time of his disappearance, he was living a transient lifestyle, and camped in wooded areas.

Jacket: Cotton, Grey, Blue, BUSH, Flannel jacket in the colours grey, blue, beige and brown
Shoes: White, Orange, RUNNERS, Running shoes in the colours white, orange and navy blue
Sweater: Blue, HOODIE, Hooded sweater in the colour navy blue

Case reference: 2014002960.CaseDesc: David Wycotte was last seen by his family on November 1, 1975, in Williams Lake, British Columbia. Up until December 1975, David was working in Winfield, British Columbia as a berry picker. David has been known to travel the area and the United States looking for labour jobs.

Case reference: 2012020051.CaseDesc: Emily Ballantyne departed Lynn Lake the evening of April 27, 1991, heading to Thompson, MB with two male acquaintances. It is believed the trio arrived in Thompson late that evening, and they went their separate ways.  Ms Ballantyne has not been seen since and her whereabouts remain unknown.

Jacket: White, blue and pink on shoulder and elasticized waist

Case reference: 2008016999.CaseDesc: Meryl Newcombe and George Weeden were last seen and reported missing to the White River OPP on October 29, 1959. The two men had been at a lodge operated by Mr. Newcombe at Mile 107 of the CPR line, west of Chapleau, Ontario. Mr. Weeden and Mr. Newcombe had planned a hunting trip and both were last seen between mile marker 106 and 107 of the CPR line southeast of White River and west of Chapleau. A large-scale search was conducted at the time, and again in the following spring (1960).  The search failed to locate the two men, and to date, they have not been located. Mr. Weeden exact date of birth is not known, but his year of birth is understood to be 1896 or 1897.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Leg, injured in a train wreck in 1941

Case reference: 2014002831.CaseDesc: On December 26, 1980, Zulfiqar Charania was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Zulfiqar lived in Ottawa but was at his sister’s home in Montreal to spend the holidays. When Zulfiqar left Montreal he did so without his suitcase, which was filled with his personal belongings. Zulfiqar had indicated that he intended on travelling to New York in the United States to visit another family member.

Case reference: 2014003025.CaseDesc: On March 5, 1989, Barbara McLaughlin was last seen leaving a friends residence in Roseville, Michigan in the USA.  A few days later Barbara's car was discovered on the Bluewater Bridge in Sarnia, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004917.CaseDesc: Robert Rudish and Lee Vrba arrived in Island Lake Manitoba on June 11, 1972, to fish. On June 17, RCMP received a report that a canoe was found overturned in the water. The canoe was soon identified as belonging to Mr. Vrba. RCMP Investigators surmised the men went missing on either the Thursday or the Friday. The weather on both days was extreme, with high winds gusting to 30 mph, which caused the lake to be quite rough. Neither of the two men have been located and it is presumed both drowned.

Tattoo: tattoo on right or left forearm

Case reference: 2021030286.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2021, Mona Hu was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Mona had been in contact with her family in China, and was arranging to travel to see them.

Case reference: 2020011625.CaseDesc: On or around January 15, 1975, John Hovey was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004987.CaseDesc: On September 6, 2004, Cassandra Wright was seen for the last time leaving the Homewood Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Cassandra said that she would be back in the morning.

Case reference: 2014006747.CaseDesc: Jian Ping Li and her 6 month old baby, Xiao Feng Lu, were last seen at their family residence in Brossard on April 30, 2014, around 9:40 a.m. When her husband returned, around 2:30 p.m., there was nobody home and the back door was unlocked.  Ms. Li's car was still at the residence. She left without her purse, her wallet, money, her credit card, and her cell phone, the diaper bag for the baby, the baby stroller and the car seat.

Case reference: 2014005543.CaseDesc: In December 2010, Yellowknife RCMP received a call from a concerned family member reporting that they have not seen or heard from Kelvin Smallgeese since September 2010. At the time of his disappearance, Kelvin was believed to be residing in Yellowknife, Northwest Territories.

Teeth: Dental records indicate 6 teeth missing, 11 treated (occlusal) 15 unknown
Tattoo: Left Hand, A rose and a heart

Case reference: 2020008707.CaseDesc: On the evening of June 23, 1978, Bonny Ainslie Laframboise was seen for the last time as she went for a walk in Toronto, Ontario. Shortly after midnight, Bonnie called her husband to tell him she was lost.

Case reference: 2014001617.CaseDesc: On January 25, 1976, Camille Lessard was last seen in Montreal, Quebec. He regularly went to the tavern located on the corner of Papineau  and Sainte-Catherine East in the Le Village district of Montreal, Quebec. Camille suffers from memory loss.

Case reference: 2014004024.CaseDesc: On December 6, 1989, Ernestine Kasyon was seen for the last time while leaving a residence to use a payphone in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2019026482.CaseDesc: Kristofer Couture drove his vehicle from Alberta to the lower mainland in British Columbia to find work and had cut off ties from his family. Kristofer worked construction for a short period of time while living in his vehicle near Maple Ridge, British Columbia. Kristofer also frequented a gym in Burnaby, British Columbia. Kristofer was last seen leaving the Royal Columbian Hospital in New Westminster, British Columbia on January 26, 2019. His unoccupied vehicle was seen the following day parked at the Elk Mountain Trail in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Kristofer was reported missing on May 17, 2019 and his vehicle was found parked at the same location.

Case reference: 2006013799.CaseDesc:
Katherine May Wilson was last seen on October 20, 1970, walking along Harvey Kirkland Road, in Kirkland Lake, Ontario. Extensive searches have failed to locate her.
Barry Manion was arrested on January 6, 2009, and pled guilty to murder on March 11, 2009.  He was sentenced to life in prison for her murder. Katherine's body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2009005499.CaseDesc: Joanne Foley was last seen in May of 1989, when she was staying with friends in Port McNicoll, Ontario.  She had mentioned that she was planning on going to western Canada, but there is no indication that she travelled there.  She has had no contact with friends or relatives since May 1989.

Case reference: 2013000040.CaseDesc: On July 16, 2002, Bruce Forbes was seen for the last time at a Regent Road residence in Halifax, Nova Scotia. Mr. Forbes suffered from a serious health condition, and required medication on a daily basis. It is believed that Mr. Forbes was not in possession of this medication at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2015011654.CaseDesc: On December 3, 1994, a baby was found in the Rivière des Prairies between the island of Montréal and the Visitation park Island in the Ahuntsic neighborhood. The body was naked and had a plastic bag wrapped around the wrist. According to experts the body would have been in the water since the fall.

Case reference: 2014003039.CaseDesc: Réal Généreux was last seen on October 20, 1980, in Montreal. He was a taxi driver and was known to frequent a tavern on Mont-Royal Street. Following an accident, Réal had difficulty walking due to pain he had in his spine.

Case reference: 2014002231.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1980, Heinz Gamper was seen for the last time when he went mountain climbing in Jasper National Park in Jasper, Alberta. Following this time, Heinz was scheduled to work, but he did not attend his scheduled shift.
